message.content:
cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with the Byzantine agreement problem in distributed systems, which is a classic problem in distributed computing. The paper proposes a generalization of the classical Byzantine model to consider partial Byzantine failures, where some processes might send corrupted messages to a subset of the processes. This suggests that the paper could belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The paper also presents a corresponding Byzantine agreement algorithm and proves its optimality by giving resilience and complexity bounds, which suggests that it could belong to the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category. The paper deals with security and fault tolerance in distributed systems, which suggests that it could belong to the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category. The paper also involves information theory and communication complexity, which suggests that it could belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with control and optimization in distributed systems, which suggests that it could belong to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category.
